summary: global and regional estimates of violence against women: prevalence and health effects of intimate partner violence and non-partner sexual violence. nearly one third of women in a relationship experience physical and/or sexual violence by their intimate partner. 1.4 billion is earmarked to go to SHARP, to assist people inside the country, and US$ 3 billion to RRP, which provides life-saving aid and protection to Syrian refugees in the surrounding region. many of the country’s health facilities are out of service, including 33 (37%) of its 89 hospitals and 146 (8%) of its 1919 health centres. there is no evidence of widespread person-to-person transmission of MERS-CoV. there has been close contact between someone who was sick and another person, such as a family member, a fellow patient or a health-care worker. health problems observed during and after floods include injuries, heart attacks, electrocutions, poisonings and acute mental health conditions. health problems observed during and after floods include injuries, heart attacks, electrocutions, poisonings and acute mental health conditions.
